p: In other hand, it was ratified the suitability of CWW as low-cost substrate for biosurfactant production. Commonly, it is used as nitrogen source, because it has a high presence of nitrogen in its composition [ 8, 25, 33, 34] (see Additional file 1: Table S1). Earlier, Ferraz et al. [ 33] showed the ability of the biosurfactant produced by S. marcescens to reduce water surface tension of 72–28 mN/m using CWW as substrate. Similarly, this residue was used for biosurfactant production by Bacillus sp. and results showed a reduction in surface tension of 59–26 mN/m [ 34]. The use of CWW can contribute considerably to the diminution of cost production of biosurfactants, since it is estimated that raw materials represent 30% of the total costs of bioprocess [ 1, 13, 35].
